title: ANOVA_1 {Repbio}
text: function ANOVA_1 performs 1-way ANOVA using function aov() R stats package. Inside function: Analysis Variance performed using aov() function package stats (version 3.6.2). Results aved txt file named : ANOVA plus name model variables, acronym criteria established classify active females reproduction (criterio) txt extension. analysis performed Salas-Singh et al. (2022), “criterion” object presents two options: BP: Separate immature mature; AR: Separate reproductively active mature organisms reproductively inactive mature immature organisms. function requires defining: formula: formula specifying model used df: data frame displays data factor level (rows) month (column). criterio: Criteria separating active reproductive organisms See also: aov anova package stats (version 3.6.2)

title: ANOVA_1 {Repbio}
text: function included Repbio package Reproductive biology analysis. function detailed .
code: #library(Repbio) ANOVA_1 <- function(formula,df,criterio){             av1 <- aov(formula,df)             anova1 <- anova(av1)              sink(paste0("04_Tablas/ANOVA_",as.character(formula)[2],                   as.character(formula)[3],"_",as.character(criterio),".txt"))                   print(anova1)    # Guardo salida ANOVA en archivo txt             sink()        # Cerrar sink             av1   } #End function

title: ANOVA_1 {Repbio}
text: Falta detallar el ejemplo
code: #formula <- LT~Phase #criterio <- "AR" #ejemplo <- ANOVA_1(formula,df,criterio)

title: BCA {Repbio}
text: function BCA Calculates percentage category (rows) function takes data frame (df), requires significance value (pval) calculates nonparametric confidence intervals (CI): Symmetric (IC), Bias-corrected (BC) BC accelerated (BCA) returns customized table using expss package. table b_BCA model parameters (row): original (opt), low (lw) high () CI, bias coefficient variation (CV): Opt, IClw, ICup, BClw, BCup, BCAlw, BCAup, Bias, CV. function requires defining: df: data frame array. pval: significance level defined user. B: integer value, specify number resamples. Seealso: expss package expss (version 0.11.6)

title: BCA {Repbio}
text: function included Repbio package Reproductive biology analysis. function detailed .
code: #library(Repbio) BCA <-function(df, pval, B){   whichcol <- which(apply(is.na(df),2,sum)==0)   d <- df[,whichcol]   nrd <- nrow(d)   # Values are defined   Opt <- d[1, ]   x <- (d[2:nrd, ])   Med <-apply(x,2,median)   Avg <- apply(x,2,mean)   de <- apply(x,2,sd)   # CI Bias-corrected   menor <- as.vector(sum_col(d[-1 , ] < d[rep(1, nrow(d) - 1), ],na.rm=TRUE)/B )   Z <-  qnorm(menor , mean= 0, sd= 1,  lower.tail = FALSE)   Plw <- 1-pnorm(2*Z-1.96,mean= 0, sd= 1, pval, lower.tail = FALSE)   Pup <- 1-pnorm(2*Z+1.96,mean= 0, sd= 1, pval, lower.tail = FALSE)   Bias <- (100*((Avg-Opt)/Opt))   CV <- de/Avg   # CI Bias-corrected and accelerated BCA   pk2s <- sum_col(d[-1 , ] - d[rep(1, nrow(d) - 1), ],na.rm=TRUE)   num <- (pk2s)^3   den <- (pk2s)^2   ac <- abs(num/(6*den^(3/2)))   # CI BCA   Zlw <- abs((pval/2)+(((pval/2)-Plw)/(1-ac*((pval/2)+Plw))))   # To avoid errors, when the value of a parameter is repeated (roughly)   Zlw[menor == 0]  <- pval/2   Zlw[Zlw > 1]  <- pval/2   Zup <- abs((1-pval/2)+(((1-pval/2)-Pup)/(1-ac*((1-pval/2)+Pup))))   Zup[menor == 0]  <- 1-pval/2   Zup[Zup > 1]  <- 1-pval/2    # CI: symmetric, BC, BCa   intlw <-  rep(pval/2,length(whichcol))   intup <-  rep(1-pval/2,length(whichcol))   int <-  rbind(intlw,intup,Plw,Pup,Zlw,Zup)   int[is.na(int)] <- 1  # Tengo que ver como arreglar mientras 1   int                     # pedir que si es Na,no haga nada y siga   # The table is saved   for(l in 1:length(whichcol)){     ICS <-  quantile(d[,l],int[,l])     b_BCA[l,] <- unlist(t(c(Opt=Opt[l],ICS,Bias=Bias[l],CV=CV[l])))   }     # End for l   print(b_BCA) }     # End function BCA

title: BCA {Repbio}
text: Falta detallar el ejemplo
code: #df <- tmp #pval <- 0.05 #B <- 300 #ejemplo <- BCA(df, 0.05, B)

title: IC_plot {Repbio}
text: Cumulative percentage mature females length. Fitting model estimation L50 values confidence interval. returs graphic representation cumulative percentage mature females function length (points). fitted model (black line) 95% confidence interval (gray shaded area) included; horizontal dashed line represents cumulative ratio 0.5; vertical dashed line indicates L50 value outer lines 95% confidence interval. function requires defining: x: vector containing values independent variable.. y: vector containing values dependent variable.. df: data frame. MClw: Lower value defined x-axis. MCup: Upper value defined x-axis CIl: table lower value nonparametric confidence interval. CIh: table upper value nonparametric confidence interval. xl: label X-axis. yl: label y-axis. See also: smooth.spline() stats R package rgb() function grDevices package

title: IC_plot {Repbio}
text: function included Repbio package Reproductive biology analysis. function detailed .
code: #library(Repbio) IC_plot <- function(x,y,yc,MClw,MCup,CIl,CIh,xl,yl){   # Prediction lines and confidence intervals are smoothed   smooth_yc <-  smooth.spline(x, yc, spar=0.4)   CIls <- smooth.spline(x, CIl, spar=0.4)   CIhs <- smooth.spline(x, CIh, spar=0.4)   CIl <- as.vector(CIls$yin)   CIh <- as.vector(CIhs$yin)       plot(x,y,        xlab= xl,        ylab= yl,        xlim= c(MClw,MCup),        ylim= c(0,1),        xaxt= "n",        yaxt= "n",        pch= 16, cex=0.8)   lines(smooth_yc,col = "black", type = "l", lty = 1)    polygon(c(x,rev(x)), c(CIl,rev(CIh)),           col=rgb(0.5, 0.5, 0.5,0.2), border=NA)   } # End function

title: Label_Phases {Repbio}
text: function returns maturity phase label used tables figures. returns ‘Phases_legend’ vector roman numeral name English Spanish according user’s choice. Arguments ‘genero’ (Gender),‘idioma’ (Lenguage) Phases (maturity phases) * genero: Value 1 selects Females 2 Males * idioma: Value 1 selects English language 2 Spanish language * Phases: Value 1 selects roman numeral 2 phases name function requires defining: genero: integer value define labels gender. idioma: integer value define labels language. Phases: integer value define labels phases maturity. See also: aov anova package stats (version 3.6.2)

title: Label_Phases {Repbio}
text: function included Repbio package Reproductive biology analysis. function detailed .
code:
#library(Repbio) Label_Phases <- function(genero,idioma, Phases) {   if(genero==1){     if(Phases==1){       Phases_legend <- c("I", "II", "III","IV","V","VI")     }else{       if(idioma==1){         Phases_legend <- c("Immature","Developing","Spawning 
 capable",                            "Actively 
 spawning","Spent","Regenerating")       }else{         #Sys.setlocale("LC_ALL", "ES_ES.UTF-8")  # Spanish characters         Phases_legend <- c("Inmaduro","Desarrollo","Capaz de 
 desovar",                            "Desovador 
 activo","Desovado",                            "Regeneración")       } # End if idioma     } # End if Phases   }else{     if(Phases==1){       Phases_legend <- c("I", "II", "III","IV")     }else{       if(idioma==1){         Phases_legend <- c("Immature","Developing","Actively 
 spawning",                            "Resting")       }else{         #Sys.setlocale("LC_ALL", "ES_ES.UTF-8")  # Spanish characters         Phases_legend <- c("Inmaduro","Desarrollo",                            "Eyaculador 
 activo","Regeneración")       } # End if idioma     } # End if Phases   } # End if genero  } # End function

title: Tukey_HSD {Repbio}
text: function performs multiple comparisons treatments means Tukey p value ANOVA_1 test equal less pval defined user. TukeyHSD test (Tukey Honest Significant Differences) use HSD.test() agricolae package. returns: * TukeyHSD test table hsd_out saved txt file : Tukey plus name model variables, acronym criteria established classify active females reproduction (criterio) txt extension. *TukeyHSD contrast plot saved pdf file : Tukey plus name model variables, acronym criteria established classify active females reproduction (criterio) txt extension. object “criterio” must defined outside function. analysis performed Salas-Singh et al. (2022), “criterion” object presents two options: * BP: Separate immature mature; * AR: Separate reproductively active mature organisms reproductively inactive mature immature organisms. function requires defining: Prob: summary ANOVA-1 function. pval: significance level (user defined). HSD_main: mine title (user defined). HSD_trt: Constant( y=model) vector treatment applied experimental unit. fn_hsd: function included package Repbio, returns phase names descending order average response values. etiquetas: data frame containing user-defined labels used throughout routine. formula: formula notation y~f y response (independent) variable f factor (categorical) variable representing group membership. criterio: Criteria separating active reproductive organisms. Phases_legend: character vector name number maturity stages, defined user. {}{} See also: fn_hsd agricolae (version 1.3-7).

title: Tukey_HSD {Repbio}
text: function included Repbio package Reproductive biology analysis. function detailed .
code: #library(Repbio) Tukey_HSD <- function(Prob, pval, HSD_main, HSD_trt, fn_hsd, etiquetas,                       formula, criterio, Phases_legend){   #  if (summary(Prob)[[1]][1, 5]<= 0.05){   hsd_out <- agricolae::HSD.test(Prob, HSD_trt, group=TRUE,console=TRUE,                       main=HSD_main, unbalanced = TRUE)   sink(paste0("04_Tablas/Tukey_", as.character(formula)[2], "_",               as.character(formula)[1],"_", criterio, ".txt"))   print(hsd_out)   sink()        # End sink    # LTPh Contrast plot  ----   r_names <- fn_hsd(hsd_out,Phases_legend) # Phase names are added.    pdf(paste0("03_Figuras/Tukey_", as.character(formula)[2],"_",              as.character(formula)[1],"_", criterio, ".pdf"))   plot(hsd_out, xlab=etiquetas[6], ylab=etiquetas[5],xaxt = "n")   par(usr=c(0.2,6.8,0.2,7))   axis(1, labels = r_names, cex.axis=0.75,        tick = FALSE, at=1:length(r_names))   dev.off()   #   } # End if }  # End function

title: bs {Repbio}
text: function bs generates matrix resamples length replacement. original data set stored first row, resamples stored \(i_{th}\) row \(B_{}+1\), \(B\) total number resamples. returns matrix mb includes original data set \(i_{th}\) generated resamples. seed value pseudorandom number, integer value defined user. results returned time number used, example: seed <- 100; seed <- NULL, different results returned time. information, see set.seed() documentation simEd package. function requires defining: df: data frame array. B: integer value, specify number resamples. n: integer value indicating number observations. semilla: integer value seed initialize pseudorandom number. Seealso: set.seed package simEd (2.0.1)

title: bs {Repbio}
text: function included Repbio package Reproductive biology analysis. function detailed .
code: #library(Repbio) bs <- function(df,B,n,semilla) {   set.seed(semilla)     mb <- matrix(sample(df, size = B * n,                       replace = TRUE), B, n)     mb <- rbind(df,mb)  # The resampling data is added with the original data }     # End function bs

title: bs {Repbio}
text: Falta detallar el ejemplo
code: #       df = tmp #       B <- 2000 #       n <- 3000 #       semilla <- 100 # # Reproducing the same output every time #       ejemplo <- bs(df,B,n,semilla) #  # # Reproducing the different output every time #       semilla <- NULL #       ejemplo <- bs(df,B,n,semilla)

Colors manipulated rgb() function grDevices package function requires defining: x: vector containing values independent variable.. y: vector containing values dependent variable.. df: data frame. xl: label X-axis. yl: label y-axis. Icut: threshold Value. ylimit: vector value minimum maximum limit y-axis. See also: rgb() grDevices (version 3.6.2)

title: fn_coincide {Repbio}
text: coincidence microscopy classification GSI analyzed. count based number pairs coincide (C) number pairs misqualified: mature immature (MI) immature mature (IM). Return filled table number coincidences discrepancies factor levels total (rows) category (columns): Coincidence (C), mature immature (MI) immature mature (IM). function requires defining: N_Phase: numerical value indicating number factor levels. df: data frame values individual (row) variables (columns). Icut: numerical value threshold value separate two groups. Coincide: table filled NA, N+1 rows, one factor level plus 1 total, four columns, first name factor levels rest categories: C, MI IM.

title: fn_coincide {Repbio}
text: function included Repbio package Reproductive biology analysis. function detailed .
code: #library(Repbio) fn_coincide <- function(N_Phase, df, Icut, Coincide){   df$PHIGS <- (ifelse(df$GSI >= Icut, 1, 0))     for(i in 1:N_Phase+1){     if(i < N_Phase+1){       OK <- ifelse(df$Phase == i & df$MATURE == df$PHIGS, 1,0)       MI <- ifelse(df$Phase == i & df$MATURE > df$PHIGS, 1,0)       IM <- ifelse(df$Phase == i & df$MATURE < df$PHIGS, 1,0)       Phase <- paste0("Phase_", as.roman(i))     }else{       OK <- ifelse(df$MATURE == df$PHIGS, 1,0)       MI <- ifelse(df$MATURE > df$PHIGS, 1,0)       IM <- ifelse(df$MATURE < df$PHIGS, 1,0)       Phase <- "Total"     } # End if     Coincide [i,] <- c(Phase,sum(OK),sum(MI),sum(IM))   } # End for   Coincide } # End function

title: fn_freq {Repbio}
text: interval class mark defined absolute, cumulative relative cumulative frequency calculated table. returns table absolute, cumulative relative cumulative frequency interval class mark. function requires defining: df: data frame array. Imin: Minimum value defined x-axis. Imax: Maximum value defined x-axis. bin: bin value define width class interval.

title: fn_freq {Repbio}
text: function included Repbio package Reproductive biology analysis. function detailed .
code: #library(Repbio) fn_freq <- function(df, Imin, Imax, bin){                   breaks<- seq(Imin, Imax, bin)                   tmp.cut <- cut(df,breaks, right=FALSE)                   fre = table(tmp.cut)                   cum <- cumsum(fre)                   frc <- cum/max(cum)                   MCmin <- Imin+(bin/2)                   MCmax <- Imax-(bin/2)                   MC<- seq(MCmin,MCmax,bin)                   cbind(MC,fre,cum,frc) }   # End function

title: fn_hsd {Repbio}
text: row name used sort factor column result TukeyHSD test. renamed name phases finally, sorted, decreasing mode, average response values (column 1). returns vector names phases arranged descending order average response. function requires defining: hsd_out: TukeyHSD test table, comes result Tukey_HSD function. Phases_legend: character vector name number maturity stages defined user.

title: fn_hsd {Repbio}
text: function included Repbio package Reproductive biology analysis. function detailed .
code: #library(Repbio) fn_hsd <- function(hsd_out,Phases_legend){   hsd_tmp <- hsd_out$groups[order(rownames(hsd_out$groups)), ]   rownames(hsd_tmp) <- Phases_legend   hsd_tmp <- hsd_tmp[order(hsd_tmp[,1], decreasing = TRUE),]   r_names <- rownames(hsd_tmp)   return <- r_names } # End fn_hsd

title: fn_porcentaje {Repbio}
text: Calculates percentage category (rows) per column (month), also includes total number data per column (N). analysis performed Salas-Singh et al. (2022), immatures fish may may included analysis. “immatures” object assigned zero, excluded analysis, non-zero value includes . returns table percentage category N. function requires defining: df: data frame array, including number data factor level (rows) month (column). meses: vector characters representing initials months year. immatures: integer value defined outside function. Phases_legend: vector name number stages maturity, specified object Phases, outside function. Legend phases: 1 roman numeral, 2 names. Seealso: FDist package stats (version 3.6.2)

title: fn_porcentaje {Repbio}
text: function included Repbio package Reproductive biology analysis. function detailed .
code: #library(Repbio) fn_porcentaje <- function(df, meses, immatures, Phases_legend) {   # Total data number per column   n_mes <- round(apply(X= df, MARGIN=2, FUN= sum),0)   n_mes[n_mes == 0] <- "-"   # Percentage calculation   for (ii in 1:length(meses)) {     if(sum(df[,ii]) == 0){       df[ii] <-"-"     }else{       df[ii] <- round(100*df[,ii]/sum(df[,ii]),0)     }  #end if   } #end for    # Add total data number per column   countsp <- rbind (df,n_mes)   names(countsp) <-meses       if (immatures == 0){           rownames(countsp) <- c(Phases_legend[-c(1)],"N")       } else{           rownames(countsp) <- c(Phases_legend,"N")       } # end if   countsp } # end Function

title: modelo {Repbio}
text: Fit model using nlsLM function. details see function documentation: nlsLM() minpack.lm (version 1.2-4). Arguments ‘genero’ (Gender),‘idioma’ (Lenguage) Phases (maturity phases) * genero: Value 1 selects Females 2 Males * idioma: Value 1 selects English language 2 Spanish language * Phases: Value 1 selects roman numeral 2 phases name function requires defining: x: independent variable. y: dependent variable. mod: nonlinear model formula including variables parameters. coerced formula necessary. bb: list numeric vector starting estimates. par list, element must length 1. bmin: numeric vector lower bounds parameter. given, default lower bound parameter set -Inf. bmax: numeric vector upper bounds parameter. given, default upper bound parameter set Inf. See also: nlsLM minpack.lm (version 1.2-4).

title: modelo {Repbio}
text: function included Repbio package Reproductive biology analysis. function detailed .
code: #library(Repbio) modelo <- function(x,y,mod,bb,bmin,bmax){   nlsLM(formula = mod,         start = bb,         lower = bmin,         upper = bmax   ) } # End function

title: modelo {Repbio}
text: Falta detallar el ejemplo
code: # modelo(x,y,mod,bb,bmin,bmax)

title: modelo {Repbio}
text: Salas‐Singh, C., Morales‐Bojórquez, E., & Aguirre‐Villaseñor, H. (2022). Reproductive biology bullseye puffer Sphoeroides annulatus: Gonadosomatic index suitability estimating length maturity. Journal Fish Biology, 101(5), 1119-1133.https://doi.org/10.1111/jfb.15174

title: strb {Repbio}
text: function helps visual search starting input parameters nlsLM, fit specified model (mod), using graph visual adjustment model parameters (Trial Error Strategy). returns: plot observed, fitted values confidence interval, model settings list. function requires defining: b3: initial value medium asymptote. Valid double sigmoid model, NA assigned simple model. b4: initial value coordinate inflection point simple sigmoid model. double sigmoid model, corresponds first inflection point. b5: initial value amplitudes sigmoid, double sigmoid model corresponds amplitude first sigmoid. b5= L95a-b4 ,L95a lengths 95 percent maturity complete sigmoid (single model) first sigmoid (double model). b6: coordinate second inflection point. Valid double sigmoid model, NA assigned simple model. b7: initial value amplitude second sigmoid. Valid double sigmoid model, NA assigned simple model. b7= L95b-b6 ,L95b lengths 95 percent maturity second distribution. x: independent variable. y: dependent variable. mod: nonlinear model formula including variables parameters. modelo: function Repbio, fit specified model (mod). bl: Lower (bl) weight values apply parameter (bi). bu: Upper (bu) weight values apply parameter (bi) xl: Title label X axis. yl: Title label Y axis. See also: nlsLM minpack.lm (version 1.2-4).

title: strb {Repbio}
text: function included Repbio package Reproductive biology analysis. function detailed .
code: #library(Repbio) strb <- function(b3,b4,b5,b6,b7,x,y,mod,modelo, bl, bu, xl, yl){   bb <- c(b3=b3,b4=b4,b5=b5,b6=b6,b7=b7)   bb <- bb[!is.na(bb)]   bmin <- c(bb*bl)   bmax <- c(bb*bu)   fit <- modelo(x,y,mod,bb,bmin,bmax)    plot(x,y,        xlab=xl,        ylab= yl)   lines(x,fitted(fit))    fit } # End function

title: strb {Repbio}
text: Falta detallar el ejemplo
code: # strb(b3,b4,b5,b6,b7,x,y,mod,modelo, bl, bu, xl, yl)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Hugo Aguirre-Villaseñor. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Aguirre-Villaseñor H (2024). Repbio: Reproductive biology analysis. R package version 0.1.0, https://macrurido.github.io/Repbio/, https://github.com/Macrurido/Repbio.git.
code: @Manual{,   title = {Repbio: Reproductive biology analysis},   author = {Hugo Aguirre-Villaseñor},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0, https://macrurido.github.io/Repbio/},   url = {https://github.com/Macrurido/Repbio.git}, }

title: Reproductive biology analysis
text: Repbio package: Reproductive biology analysis methodological package developed carry analyzes article: Salas-Singh et al. (2022) describe updated information basic reproductive biology bullseye puffer Sphoeroides annulatus females potential use gonadosomatic index input data assess length 50% maturity identify breeding season. Also verify maturity patterns analysed data assessed single double sigmoid models, including selection suitable model. purpose, functions vignette created explain process step step. tables figures personalized. length 50 maturity estimated fitting accumulated data mature females two models: simple sigmoid (MSS) double sigmoid (MDS), using two data sources: histological (MATURE) gonadosomatic index (GSI). package consists sixteen functions facilitate implementation methodology used analysis: ANOVA_1: Performs 1-way ANOVA using function aov() R Stats Package, returns list av1 save ANOVA results txt file. BCA: Nonparametric confidence intervals. function takes data frame (df), requires significance value (pval) calculates nonparametric confidence intervals (CI): Symmetric (IC), Bias-corrected (BC) BC accelerated (BCA). bs: function ‘bs’ generates matrix resamples length replacement. original data set stored first row, resamples stored ith row Bi+1, B total number resamples. fn_Barplot: simple barplot generated labels marks X-axis, serves basis generated analysis, whether simple compound figures. fn_Boxplot: simple multiple boxplots (one level factor) generated labels marks X-axis. serves basis figures generated analysis, whether simple complex. fn_coincide: coincidence microscopy classification GSI analyzed. count based number pairs coincide (C) number pairs misqualified: mature immature (MI) immature mature (IM). fn_freq: interval class mark defined absolute, cumulative relative cumulative frequency calculated table. fn_hsd: factor column resulting TukeyHSD test sorted row name, renamed name phases finally, sorted, decreasing way, average response values (column 1). fn_Idioma figure labels defined either English (1) Spanish (2). fn_LTGSI: scattering plot generated without labels marks X-axis, simple. horizontal line included threshold value, serves basis figures generated analysis, whether simple compound figures. fn_porcentaje: Calculates percentage category (rows) per column (month), also includes total number data per column (N). IC_plot: Cumulative percentage mature females length. Fitting model estimation L50 values confidence interval. Label_Phases: Returns maturity phase label used tables figures. returns ‘Phases_legend’ vector roman numeral name English Spanish. modelo: Fit model using nlsLM function. details see function documentation: nlsLM() minpack.lm (version 1.2-4). strb: function helps visual search starting input parameters nlsLM, fit specified model (mod), using graph visual adjustment model parameters (Trial Error Strategy). Tukey_HSD: function performs multiple comparisons treatments means Tukey p value ANOVA_1 test equal less pval defined user. HSD.test() came agricolae package.

title: Reproductive biology analysis
text: Salas‐Singh, C., Morales‐Bojórquez, E., & Aguirre‐Villaseñor, H. (2022). Reproductive biology bullseye puffer Sphoeroides annulatus: Gonadosomatic index suitability estimating length maturity. Journal Fish Biology, 101(5), 1119-1133.https://doi.org/10.1111/jfb.15174

title: ANOVA_1 — ANOVA_1
text: function performs 1-way ANOVA using function aov() R Stats     Package, returns list av1 save ANOVA results txt file. Inside function: Analysis Variance performed using aov() function     package stats (version 3.6.2). Results aved txt file named :     ANOVA plus name model variables, acronym criteria established     classify active females reproduction (criterio) txt extension. object "criterio" must defined outside function.     analysis performed Salas-Singh et al. (2022), "criterion" object presents two options:     BP: Separate immature mature;     AR: Separate reproductively active mature organisms reproductively inactive mature immature organisms.

title: ANOVA_1 — ANOVA_1
code: ANOVA_1(formula, df, criterio)

title: ANOVA_1 — ANOVA_1
text: formula formula specifying model df data frame criterio Criteria separating active reproductive organisms

title: ANOVA_1 — ANOVA_1
text: txt file ANOVA results

title: ANOVA_1 — ANOVA_1
code: if (FALSE) {     formula <- LT~Phase     df <- tmp     criterio <- "AR"     ejemplo <- ANOVA_1(formula,df,criterio)   }

title: BCA Nonparametric confidence intervals — BCA
text: function takes data frame (df), requires significance value (pval) calculates nonparametric confidence intervals (CI): Symmetric (IC), Bias-corrected (BC) BC accelerated (BCA)

title: BCA Nonparametric confidence intervals — BCA
code: BCA(df, pval, B)

title: BCA Nonparametric confidence intervals — BCA
text: df data.frame pval significance level defined user B integer value, specify number resamples

title: BCA Nonparametric confidence intervals — BCA
text: returns customized table using expss package. table `b_BCA` model parameters (row): original (opt), low (lw) high () CI, bias coefficient variation (CV): Opt, IClw, ICup, BClw, BCup, BCAlw, BCAup, Bias, CV.

title: BCA Nonparametric confidence intervals — BCA
code: if (FALSE) {     df <- tmp     pval <- 0.05     B <- 2000     ejemplo <- BCA(df, pval, B)   }

text: Cumulative percentage mature females length. Fitting model    estimation L50 values confidence interval.

title: IC_plot — IC_plot
text: x vector X-axis values y vector y-axis values yc vector Y values calculated original data MClw Lower value defined x-axis MCup Upper value defined x-axis CIl table lower value nonparametric confidence interval CIh table upper value nonparametric confidence interval xl label X-axis yl label y-axis

title: IC_plot — IC_plot
text: returs graphic representation cumulative percentage mature females function length (points). fitted model (black line) 95 percent confidence interval (gray shaded area) included; horizontal dashed line represents cumulative ratio 0.5; vertical dashed line indicates L50 value outer lines 95 percent confidence interval.

title: IC_plot — IC_plot
code: if (FALSE) {  IC_plot(x,y,yc,MClw,MCup,CIl,CIh,xl,yl)   }

title: Label_Phases — Label_Phases
text: function returns maturity phase label used tables figures. returns 'Phases_legend' vector roman numeral name English Spanish according user's choice.

title: Label_Phases — Label_Phases
code: Label_Phases(genero, idioma, Phases)

title: Label_Phases — Label_Phases
text: genero integer value define labels gender idioma integer value define labels language Phases integer value define labels phases maturity

title: Label_Phases — Label_Phases
text: Phases_legend

title: Label_Phases — Label_Phases
text: Arguments 'genero' (Gender),'idioma' (Lenguage) Phases (maturity phases)     genero: Value *1* selects Females *2* Males.     idioma: Value *1* selects English language *2* Spanish language.     Phases: Value *1* selects roman numeral *2* phases name.

title: Label_Phases — Label_Phases
code: if (FALSE) {     Label_Phases(1, 1, 1) # returns roman numeral for females     Label_Phases(1, 2, 1) # returns roman numeral for females     Label_Phases(1, 1, 2) # returns phases name in English for females     Label_Phases(1, 2, 2) # returns phases name in Spanish for females     Label_Phases(2, 1, 1) # returns roman numeral for males     Label_Phases(2, 2, 1) # returns roman numeral for males     Label_Phases(2, 1, 2) # returns phases name in English for males     Label_Phases(2, 2, 2) # returns phases name in Spanish for males   }

title: Tukey_HSD — Tukey_HSD
text: function performs multiple comparisons treatments means Tukey p value ANOVA_1 test equal less pval defined user. HSD.test() came agricolae package.

title: Tukey_HSD — Tukey_HSD
code: Tukey_HSD(Prob, pval, HSD_main, HSD_trt,           fn_hsd, etiquetas, formula,           criterio, Phases_legend)

title: Tukey_HSD — Tukey_HSD
text: Prob summary ANOVA-1 function. pval significance level (user defined). HSD_main mine title (user defined). HSD_trt Constant( y=model) vector treatment applied experimental unit. fn_hsd function included package Repbio, returns phase names descending order average response values. etiquetas data frame containing user-defined labels used throughout routine formula formula notation y~f y response (independent) variable f factor (categorical) variable representing group membership. criterio Criteria separating active reproductive organisms. Phases_legend character vector name number maturity stages, defined user.

title: Tukey_HSD — Tukey_HSD
text: 1) TukeyHSD test table hsd_out saved txt file : Tukey    plus name model variables, acronym criteria established    classify active females reproduction (criterio) txt extension. 2) TukeyHSD contrast plot saved pdf file : Tukey    plus name model variables, acronym criteria established    classify active females reproduction (criterio) txt extension    Note: criterio defined outside function.

title: Tukey_HSD — Tukey_HSD
text: TukeyHSD test (Tukey Honest Significant Differences) performed.

title: Tukey_HSD — Tukey_HSD
code: if (FALSE) {    pval <- 0.05    HSD_main <- LT/nPhase    HSD_trt <- Phase    Tukey_HSD(Prob, pval, HSD_main, HSD_trt, fn_hsd, etiquetas,    formula, criterio, Phases_legend)   }

title: bs — bs
text: function `bs` generates matrix resamples length replacement. original data set stored first row, resamples stored ith row Bi+1, B total number resamples.

title: bs — bs
code: bs(df, B, n, semilla)

title: bs — bs
text: df data frame B integer value indicating number resamples n integer value indicating number observations semilla integer value seed initialize pseudorandom number generator.

title: bs — bs
text: matrix **mb** includes original data set ith-generated resamples.

title: bs — bs
code: if (FALSE) {       df = tmp       B <- 2000       n <- 3000       semilla <- 100 # Reproducing the same output every time       ejemplo <- bs(df,B,n,semilla)  # Reproducing the different output every time       semilla <- NULL       ejemplo <- bs(df,B,n,semilla)     }
